triples.name: Mixed model
triples.relevance: Linear mixed models are the primary focus of the paper's critique about random effect specification in psychology research.

triples.name: Statistical inference
triples.relevance: The paper argues that evaluation of psychological hypotheses relies overwhelmingly on inferential statistical procedures.

triples.name: Random effects model
triples.relevance: The paper proposes better specification and alignment of random effects to match researchers' actual generalization intentions.

triples.name: Psychology
triples.relevance: Psychology is the primary domain where the paper identifies problems with statistical operationalization of verbal hypotheses.

triples.name: Replication crisis
triples.relevance: The paper argues that failure to align verbal and statistical expressions lies at the heart of psychology's replication crisis.
